result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Porath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $325 to the LCPD/MEG Unit (no surcharge is assessed on this restitution)
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond on file of $500 is applied to restitution ordered and then to Court financial obligations owed - SEE ASSESSMENT REPORT

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
To be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services

Jail is condition of probation on this case ONLY
.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sasa Johnen
Check# 35905 to West Central Metropolitan Enforcement Group

State by Hynek /  Def in custody w/ Atty Bernardo Cueto
CRT:  Appellate CRT decision where the penalties were messed up & it was reversed.  I think I would like the SNP to be accurate as to what he's facing as a potential penalty.  Was Drg CRT considered?
Cueto:  It wasn't brought up.  Def got these new charges & didn't want to change the plea date & Drg CRT wasn't discussed
CRT:  at first glance, in looking at his Hx & COMPAS showing high risk at first glance, it would strike me as approp & that's an addiction motivated crime
Cueto:  the only issues w/ Drg CRT is that it takes a while for him to be assessed - he's on a PO Hold & not having these cases open would make it easier for him to get out.  Julia Vandenberg is the PO
Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Notice of Right to seek Postconviction Relief filed
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT:  plea is FVI made - sufficient factual basis exists to support plea & def is found Guilty
Def:  Hopes to get thru probation & get SSDI - would like CRT to order SSI
CRT:  can't do that.  You have to qualify.  We don't have any authority over the SSA but may have authority to order you do what's in your power to go thru application process
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 3 yrs w/ conditions:  120 days CJ to be served on EM thru JSS w/ credit for 26 days (this case only);  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Pay restitution of $325 to LCPD/MEG Unit (no surcharge is applied to this restitution);  Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Apply cash bond to restitution & CRT financial obligations owed
COMPAS
PO Julia Vandenberg
From: Atty Cueto Re: reached agrmt - cancel Motion hearing - set for plea
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 2, 2015 at 11:15 am.

to SLH from ADA Hynek re: request for continuance of Motion Hearing - Officer not available.
Per SLH - ok - reschedule to 12-16-14 at 2:30pm
Def's Motion for Suppression of Identification
Def's Brief in support of Motion to Disclose Identity & Whereabouts of Info & 3rd Party
of Preliminary Exam & Arraignment - Kenda L

2:43 PM - Def in court w/ Atty Bernardo Cueto.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cueto: he's been given an ATR and I don't think he's a risk to the community and should be able to go thru the trmt as recommended by his PO. 
Hynek: 3 yrs probation for several charges. The def's chance to not be a risk the community was when he was out the first time. But he cont to deal meth. 
BOND:  $500.00 cash bond - same conditions
Bernardo Cueto
